page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: The area is divided into two topographical parts by a fault.The Northern third ,part of the Bovey Basin,is ball clay and sand,and there fore flat.The ridge rising steeply to the South runs from East to West culminating in Ingsdon and Telegraph Hills in the West.Formed from Devonian slate and capped by basalt,this upland provides pasture which supports dairy farming.Seale Hayne Agricultural College uses much of this land.The A38 trunk road cuts diagonally through the area,bounding the lower S.E.slopes of Dartmoor,and links the area to Exeter and Plymouth.Proximity to the A38 has caused development at Coldeast,Trago Mills regional shopping centre and Youngs Seafoods.Local communities and farms are served by Newton Abbot and Ashburton(secondary),Blackpool(junior) and Stover Girls (private) schools.
